TextLibrary.Text: Lord Greythane
Why have you brought us this prisoner?
Why have you brought us this prisoner?
Why have you brought us this prisoner?
Why have you brought us this prisoner?
We captured him in Skellheim. He and his Undead servant had attacked a number of travelers from Gallia.
We captured him in Skellheim. He and his Undead servant had attacked a number of travelers from Gallia.
We captured him in Skellheim. He and his Undead servant had attacked a number of travelers from Gallia.
We captured him in Skellheim. He and his Undead servant had attacked a number of travelers from Gallia.
Why didn't you leave him for the authorities in Gallia or Drakenburg to deal with? Why bring him all the way to Maethelburg?
Why didn't you leave him for the authorities in Gallia or Drakenburg to deal with? Why bring him all the way to Maethelburg?
Why didn't you leave him for the authorities in Gallia or Drakenburg to deal with? Why bring him all the way to Maethelburg?
Why didn't you leave him for the authorities in Gallia or Drakenburg to deal with? Why bring him all the way to Maethelburg?
My companion suggested that I bring him here. He seemed to think that you would want to question the prisoner. He is the third Sorcerer that has been caught in the area recently.
My companion suggested that I bring him here. He seemed to think that you would want to question the prisoner. He is the third Sorcerer that has been caught in the area recently.
My companion suggested that I bring him here. He seemed to think that you would want to question the prisoner. He is the third Sorcerer that has been caught in the area recently.
My companion suggested that I bring him here. He seemed to think that you would want to question the prisoner. He is the third Sorcerer that has been caught in the area recently.
And this companion of yours... where is he?
And this companion of yours... where is he?
And this companion of yours... where is he?
And this companion of yours... where is he?
He stayed in Gallia. You've probably heard of him - his name is Syrus Darkhunter.
He stayed in Gallia. You've probably heard of him - his name is Syrus Darkhunter.
He stayed in Gallia. You've probably heard of him - his name is Syrus Darkhunter.
He stayed in Gallia. You've probably heard of him - his name is Syrus Darkhunter.
I'll thank you to not speak that name again. You were, however, correct to bring the prisoner here.
I'll thank you to not speak that name again. You were, however, correct to bring the prisoner here.
I'll thank you to not speak that name again. You were, however, correct to bring the prisoner here.
I'll thank you to not speak that name again. You were, however, correct to bring the prisoner here.
Then you KNOW of these Sorcerers? We believe they may also be in my homeland of Agaria.
Then you KNOW of these Sorcerers? We believe they may also be in my homeland of Agaria.
Then you KNOW of these Sorcerers? We believe they may also be in my homeland of Agaria.
Then you KNOW of these Sorcerers? We believe they may also be in my homeland of Agaria.

They are followers of a cult from far to the north - servants of Bane, the Lord of Death. They have been entering our lands for some time now, causing havoc. The last one we found was placed in the custody of our Inquisitors. He did not survive long, but after he died, his body rose up as some ghoulish creature that laid waste to half of our tower. We will not make that same mistake again. The questioning this time will be... slower.

My companion, Darkhunter, is not allowed in Maethelburg. What do you have against him? He seems alright to me.
My companion, Darkhunter, is not allowed in Maethelburg. What do you have against him? He seems alright to me.
My companion, Darkhunter, is not allowed in Maethelburg. What do you have against him? He seems alright to me.
My companion, Darkhunter, is not allowed in Maethelburg. What do you have against him? He seems alright to me.
Appearances can be deceiving, boy. You'd do well to remember that. And I told you not to mention his name again, so thank you for delivering the prisoner. Now, go!

Appearances can be deceiving, girl. You'd do well to remember that. And I told you not to mention his name again, so thank you for delivering the prisoner. Now, go!
